hrid.description: The human readable ID, also called eye readable ID. A system-assigned sequential alternate ID

holdingsRecordId.description: ID of the holdings record the item is a member of

formerIds.description: Previous identifiers assigned to the item

discoverySuppress.description: Records the fact that the record should not be displayed in a discovery system

title.description: Resouce title (read only, inherited from associated instance record)

callNumber.description: Call number is an identifier assigned to an item, usually printed on a label attached to the item, and used to determine its physical position in a shelving sequence (e.g. K1 .M44, read only, inherited from associated holdings record)

barcode.description: Text, with input likely validated by the barcode scanner

accessionNumber.description: Accession number is also called inventar number. Accession number is a unique number assigned to an item in the order in which it is added to a library collection. Most libraries assign accession numbers in continous numerical sequece, but some use a code system to indicate type of material and/or year of accession in addition to order of accession

itemLevelCallNumber.description: Call number is an identifier assigned to an item, usually printed on a label attached to the item, and used to determine its physical position in a shelving sequence (e.g. K1 .M44, read only, inherited from associated holdings record). The item level call number, is the call number on item level

itemLevelCallNumberPrefix.description: Prefix of the call number on the item level

itemLevelCallNumberSuffix.description: Suffix of the call number on the item level

itemLevelCallNumberTypeId.description: Call number type, refers to a call-number-type reference record

effectiveCallNumberComponents.description: Elements of a full call number generated from the item or holding

callNumber.description: Effective Call Number is an identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

prefix.description: Effective Call Number Prefix is the prefix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

suffix.description: Effective Call Number Suffix is the suffix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

typeId.description: Effective Call Number Type Id is the call number type id assigned to the item or associated holding.

volume.description: Volume is intended for monographs when a multipart monograph (e.g. a biography of Gerorge Bernard Shaw in three volumes)

enumeration.description: Enumeration is the descriptive information for the numbering scheme of a serial, usually identified by level and a descriptive caption, e.g., level 0 = v. and level 1 = no. This means that each issue of the serial has a volume and an issue number that would appear (e.g. v.71:no.6-2)

chronology.description: Chronology is the descriptive information for the dating scheme of a serial, usually identified by level, e.g., level 0 = year level 1 = month. This means that each issue of the serial has a month and a year on each issue (e.g. 1985:July-Dec.)

yearCaption.description: In multipart monographs, a caption is characters used to label a level of chronology (e.g. 'year 1985')

itemIdentifier.description: Item identifier number, e.g. imported from the union catalogue (read only)

copyNumber.description: Copy number is the piece identifier. The copy number reflects if the library has a copy of a single-volume monograph; a copy of a multi-volume, (e.g. Copy 1, or C.7.)

numberOfPieces.description: Number of pieces. Used when an item is checked out or returned to verify that all parts are present (e.g. 7 CDs in a set)

missingPieces.description: Text which descripes the missing pieces

missingPiecesDate.description: Date when the piece(s) went missing

itemDamagedStatusId.description: Item Damage status Id, refers to an Item damage Status ID reference record

itemDamagedStatusDate.description: Date when damage status was last changed

itemNoteTypeId.description: Item note type, refers to a item-note-type reference record

note.description: Text to display (e.g. action note, binding, use and reproduction)

staffOnly.description: Records the fact that the record should only be displayed for staff

circulationNotes.description: Notes to be displayed in circulation processes

noteType.description: Type of circulation process that the note applies to

staffOnly.description: Records the fact that the note should only be displayed for staff

source.description: The user who added/updated the note. The property is generated by the server and needed to support sorting.

id.description: The id of the user who added/updated the note

date.description: Date and time the record is added/updated. The property is generated by the server and needed to support sorting.

name.description: Name of the item state (e.g. Available, Checked out, In transit, Awaiting pickup, On order). Default value is set to: Available

date.description: Date of the current item state. E.g. date set when item state was changed by the Check out app

materialType.description: Material type define what type of thing the item is

id.description: Material type Id, refers to a material type reference record

name.description: Material type name (e.g. Audio book, Audio disc, Computer file, Pamphelet)

permanentLoanType.description: Permanent loan type, is the default loan type for a given item. Loan types are tenant-defined in a reference table in Settings, Inventory, Item, Loan type (e.g. Can circulate, Course reserves, Reading room, Selected)

id.description: Permanent loan type Id, refers to a loan type reference record

temporaryLoanType.description: Temporary loan type, is the temporary loan type for a given item. Loan types are tenant-defined in a reference table in Settings, Inventory, Item, Loan type (e.g. Can circulate, Course reserves, Reading room, Selected)

id.description: Temporary loan type Id, refers to a loan type reference record

permanentLocation.description: Permanent item location is the default location, shelving location, or holding which is a physical place where items are stored, or an Online location. The location is defined by Institutions, Campuses, libraries, and locations. Permanent location can be assigned at the holding level, and be overridden at the item level if needed

id.description: Permanent location Id, refers to a location type reference record

temporaryLocation.description: Temporary item location is the temporarily location, shelving location, or holding which is a physical place where items are stored, or an Online location. The location is defined by Institutions, Campuses, libraries, and locations. Permanent location can be assigned at the holding level, and be overridden at the item level if needed

id.description: Temporary location Id, refers to a location type reference record

effectiveLocation.description: The effective location is used by FOLIO and other integrated systems to know the current home location for the item (read only, derived from locations on HoldingsRecord and Item)

electronicAccess.description: Whether an item is available electronically

uri.description: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is a string of characters designed for unambiguous identification of resources

linkText.description: Link text is used for display in place of the URL

materialsSpecification.description: Materials specified is used to specify to what portion or aspect of the resource the electronic location and access information applies (e.g. a portion or subset of the item is electronic, or a related electronic resource is being linked to the record)

publicNote.description: URL public note to be displayed in the discovery

relationshipId.description: Relationship Id, refers to a Relationship type reference record. Relationship between the electronic resource at the location identified and the item described in the record as a whole. (E.g. values from MARC 21, tag field 856 2nd indicator, where the values are: No information provided, Resource, Version of resource, Related resource, No display constant generate

statisticalCodeIds.description: Statistical code Id, refers to a Statistical code reference record

purchaseOrderLineIdentifier.description: ID referencing a remote purchase order object related to this item

metadata.description: Metadata about creation and changes, provided by the server (client should not provide)

tags.description: arbitrary tags associated with this item

lastCheckIn.description: Information about when an item was last checked in

dateTime.description: Date and time of the last check in of the item.

servicePointId.description: Service point ID being used by a staff member when item was scanned in Check in app.

staffMemberId.description: ID a staff member who scanned the item
